page.title: 17Cubs and Scouts
page.content: There is little in the form of organised leisure for the young children of Hanley Swan.Generally they play in each other's homes or gardens. However on Friday evening there is an exodus of small boys as they go to Cub Scouts.The pack meets at Hanley Castle High School and is well supported.At their meetings they play games,learn knots,go tracking and work for merit badges.Akela takes them on joint ventures with other cub packs in the area.Recently with the Scouts they put on a concert and had such fun dressing up. At the concert the Scout Master was presented with a Medal for long service in the Movement.The Scout pack is a Sea Scout troup and quite popular with the older boys.In addition to the usual Scout activities they go canoeing and sailing.
